sub_title: R&D Scientist | Technology Innovator | Magnetic Resonance Specialist | Passionate Guitarist
summary:
I am a business-oriented scientist with 20+ years of experience in the industry heading research, development, and innovation in high-tech environments. I am driven by a strong passion for solving complex industrial research problems and transferring them into high-quality and customer-oriented technology. My goal is to use my skills and knowledge within a community that pushes the technology boundaries to new limits for the betterment of global society and the improvement of people’s lives.

I collaborate with companies to integrate new technologies and product development, from idea through advanced concepts into market. I have built and led research teams, and managed change with a high capacity to adapt to continuous transformations, continuously improving the project organization. I operated as a program/project manager for transferring research to concrete solutions and enabling the development of new products to market.

I hold a PhD in Physics and have strong expertise in MRI (magnetic resonance imaging, 3D and flow tomography), quantum technology, optimization, statistical signal processing, AI (machine learning), and inverse problems (multi-component systems, RF sensors, magnet configurations). I have applied my knowledge in those fields resulting in 20+ commercial applications in the food, pharmaceutical, medical, security, process control, and oil & gas industries. I have contributed to the intellectual property of the companies I have worked with by filing 8 patent families.

With an Agile mindset, I have a leadership style characterized by an empathic and strong communication, bridging and connecting personality to resolve conflict, involve and empower the team, and foster a creative and dynamic work environment cooperating with supportive colleagues.

I enjoy communicating complex information to diverse audiences, making complicated scientific concepts accessible. This allowed me to develop excellent communication skills, managing multi-level global stakeholders, collaborating in international cross-functional environments, delivering training courses, speaking at conferences, and interacting with clients. With a pragmatic approach, pro-active attitude, result focus and a ‘can do’ spirit, I thrive in fast-paced and dynamic environments that challenge my problem-solving capacity.

I feel enthusiastic about boarding new endeavors to develop new approaches, processes, and technologies according to the demanding requirements of the current global situation.

I am happy to connect with people of any background and add value. Let’s connect!

treasury_media.title: Multiphase Flow Regime Characterization and Liquid Flow Measurement Using Low-Field Magnetic Resonance Imaging
treasury_media.description: In this work, we study two-phase air-water horizontal flows using MR technology. Flow measurements based on this method allow liquid flow rate determination with an accuracy that is independent of the multiphase flow profile observed in horizontal pipe flow for a wide dynamic range in terms of the average gas and liquid flow rates.

profile_positions.description:
I perform in the Technology Innovation team executing high-level research, setting up novel measurement techniques, and enabling Industry 4.0 capabilities for process control and flow measurement instruments.

I develop and execute a robust research strategy, based on techniques as MRI, Ultrasound, Computational Physics, Machine Learning, Inversion and Statistical Models, to translate sensor data into measurable parameters, evaluate new methods, work on next-generation applications and open new market segments.

Our team has consolidated a strong identity and has been acknowledged inside the company by delivering excellent performance and continuously improving the processes for performing R&D and linking to business goals.

• Implement change management strategies to transition from traditional (waterfall) project methodology to Agile, coach to extend the Agile framework to other projects.

• Continuously improve the Agile project organization, with strong cross-functional interaction, to deal with changing dynamics and ambiguous environment conditions affecting management organization, budget, market, customers, team size, on-site/remote/hybrid work.

• Perform the strategic development of technology roadmaps, translate them into actionable projects in alignment with the Innovation Manager, Product Manager and Development Team.

• Define requirements related to physical models and algorithms, align marketing requirements with product requirements and system integration.

• Perform risk management, to manage the research for future devices to an acceptable risk level by balancing scope, time, costs, and quality.

• Build partnerships with academic institutions and mentor participants, coach scientists and engineers, deliver training courses.

• Provide leadership with empathic and strong communication, to resolve conflict and foster a creative and dynamic work environment cooperating with supportive colleagues.
profile_positions.title: Principal R&D Scientist - Technology Innovation

profile_positions.description:
𝐊𝐞𝐲 𝐀𝐜𝐡𝐢𝐞𝐯𝐞𝐦𝐞𝐧𝐭𝐬:
 
• Introduction to the upstream oil and gas market of a Multiphase Flowmeter for the simultaneous measurement of oil, gas, and water.

• Developed 8 new methodologies combining MRI, Ultrasound, and Machine Learning, for measuring oil, gas, and water flowrates, in real time on highly unstable multiphase flow regimes. Enabled the introduction of the 4 first units in the market and subsequent sales.

• Filed 8 patent families (5 already granted).
profile_positions.title: Product Development

profile_positions.description: Provided technical and strategical guidance (mainly remotely) to the development team on the revision of the entire system architecture, troubleshooting, 3D imaging methods and reconstruction algorithms.
profile_positions.title: External Consultant

company.name: Consejo Nacional de Investigaciones Científicas y Técnicas

profile_positions.description:
I performed in the technology transfer program providing relevant scientific contributions to the industry. As program manager, I led various projects for transferring Magnetic Resonance-based technology from research to concrete solutions and enabling the development of new products to market. 

• Operated as project manager and led the research activities for 4 projects with teams of 3-10 researchers/engineers and total grants of € 650k for the development, expansion, and industrialization of the analytical use of NMR/MRI. 

• Complemented the academic and industrial partners visions as well as market trends, research topics, and emerging technologies.

• Built and fostered international collaboration projects with SWRI San Antonio (US), Shell (US/NL), Embrapa (BR) and the University of New England (US).

𝐊𝐞𝐲 𝐀𝐜𝐡𝐢𝐞𝐯𝐞𝐦𝐞𝐧𝐭𝐬:

• Delivered to the industrial partner: 4 projects TRL 1-5 with fully functional proof-of-concept systems with potential for robust commercial applications (lateral blood flowmeter, carbonated porous materials characterization, 3D multiphase flow imaging, in-line imaging for food analysis, pharmaceutical solid forms characterization) and filed 3 associated patents.

• Delivered to the academic partner: completed 2 PhD and 2 MSc, published 4 per-reviewed journal articles.
profile_positions.title: Scientific Advisor - Project Management - Technology Transfer

profile_positions.description:
I headed the R&D activities in the development of methods, software, and instrumentation. With an entrepreneurial mindset, I fulfilled multiple roles, contributing to position Spinlock, a startup spin-out of the University of Córdoba founded in 2003, into a global technology-based company specialized in the development of industrial solutions based on non-conventional smart and robust Magnetic Resonance technologies.

• Built and led an R&D team and foster a team mindset of diligent experimentation, academic curiosity and out-of-the-box thinking.

• Translated technical development targets in the R&D roadmap into an actionable program, identified and developed talent, and assigned the allocated resources to deliver maximum impact. 

• Managed multi-level stakeholders including government, global joint venture partners (US, NL, ES, BR), investors, and managers.

• Provided strong organization skills, coordinating the Physics, Analytical Chemistry, Hardware, and Software scientists/engineers for developing analysis, process and quality control equipment from the lab to concrete customer-oriented applications.
profile_positions.title: Team Leader Physics

profile_positions.description:
• Innovated in MRI & NMR methodology (physical methods, calibration protocols, signal contrast) and instrumentation (RF sensors and magnet designs). 

• Provided input from Physics to define Software and Hardware requirements.

• Organized and facilitated idea generation with customers, technical and sales key accounts. 

• Troubleshooted hardware, on product developments stage and service attending customer complaints.

• Delivered customer training and courses for the staff members. 

• Delivered technical literacy: patent disclosures, product manuals and grant proposals.

𝐊𝐞𝐲 𝐌𝐢𝐥𝐞𝐬𝐭𝐨𝐧𝐞𝐬:

2013: Product launch of the new SLK-200 Series, more advanced, compact, and efficient Magnetic Resonance System for quality assurance and control.

2012: Development of a low field MRI system for in-line food quality control, delivered at the Brazilian Agricultural Research Corporation (BR).

2012: Development of Spinlock SLK PH 100 system, analyzer for quality control of pharmaceuticals, delivered at University of New England (US).

2009: Development and validation of a Multiphase Flow Meter based on low field MRI technology, in joint venture with Shell Oil Company (US/NL).

2008: Applicability upgrade of SLK-100 as Pore Size Analyzer and validation by Shell Oil Company (US/NL).

2007: Product launch of SLK-100, Spinlock’s first magnetic resonance analyzer for food and oilseed, validated by the National Institute of Agricultural Technology (AR).

2003: Development and validation of an airport security system for detection of explosives/narcotics on hand luggage, shoes, and full-body, in joint venture with Argentinean Air Force.

Magnetic Resonance techniques: Low field MRI. Benchtop, compact, portable, mobile MRI. NMR relaxometry. NQR spectroscopy. Pulse sequence design and implementation. MRI physics. Spin dynamics. Fast acquisition and reconstruction. Compressed sensing. Numerical inversion. Inhomogeneous fields. RF sensors. Non-linear gradients. Flow MRI.
profile_positions.title: R&D Scientist - Application Scientist

profile_positions.description:
Faculty of Mathematics Astronomy and Physics, Faculty of Chemical Sciences, and Faculty of Physics and Exact Sciences.

Subjects: Basic principles in RMN and MRI (Postgraduate Curse), Chemistry Laboratory.
